meanings.definition: Relating to the writings of the early Christian theologians known as the Fathers of the Church.
meanings.sent1: The patristic texts provide valuable insights into the beliefs of early Christians.
meanings.sent2: Scholars study patristic literature to understand the thoughts of Church Fathers.
meanings.sent3: It's fascinating how patristic writings have influenced modern Christian thought.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of patristic teachings is as deep as the roots of an ancient tree.
meanings.sent5: The patristic era is like a treasure trove of wisdom waiting to be explored.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of the teachings or writings of the early Christian Church Fathers.
meanings.sent1: The patristic doctrines shaped the foundation of Christian theology.
meanings.sent2: Many churches still adhere to patristic traditions in their practices.
meanings.sent3: His patristic style of writing is reminiscent of the early Church Fathers.
meanings.sent4: The influence of patristic ideas can be seen in various religious doctrines.
meanings.sent5: The patristic influence on Christianity is like a river that flows through history.
